page.title: 01THE SOUTH DOWNS & ALFRISTON
page.content: Except for one kilometre square which is Alfriston, the rest of the area is chalk downland, used for arable farming, though there are some sheep and cattle. There are many trackways across the downs which have been in use since the Bronze Age and earlier which are now used by walkers, riders and joggers. There is a great deal of wildlife on the downs and in the spring and summer there are wildflowers of great variety and beauty growing particularly on the scarps. It is a bare landscape and what trees there are have been blown lopsided by the prevailing S.W. winds coming up the English Channel.
